content:
The architecture of ancient civilizations such as Greece and Rome has greatly influenced modern-day design in numerous ways. Some of the ways include:

1. Columns and Pediments: The use of columns and pediments in ancient Greek and Roman architecture has been a significant influence in modern-day architecture. The Doric, Ionic and Corinthian columns of ancient Greece and the Tuscan, Doric and Composite columns of Rome can be seen in buildings all over the world.

2. Symmetry: Ancient Greek and Roman architecture was built with precise symmetry, which is still evident in modern-day architecture. Symmetry provides balance and order in buildings, and it remains a fundamental aspect of contemporary design.

3. Arches and Vaults: The ancient Romans were pioneering in architectural engineering and introduced arches and vaults in their construction. Arches and vaults became a popular feature forever personal spaces such as hallways, libraries, and wine cellars.

4. Material Usage: Ancient Greek architecture saw the extensive use of marble, limestone and granite, while ancient Roman architecture saw an extensive use of materials like bricks, mortar, and concrete. The use of materials like these continues to influence modern-day construction.

5. Civic and Public Buildings: The ancient Greeks and Romans created monumental civic and public buildings, such as amphitheaters, town halls, and courts. This impacted modern-day design in government buildings and monuments.

6. Landscape Design: Ancient Greeks believed that beautiful architecture must be integrated with beautiful surroundings. This spurred the development of the art of landscape architecture. Subsequently, the Greek and Roman innovations in garden layouts continue to inspire modern-day garden and landscaping design.

In conclusion, the architecture of ancient civilizations such as Greece and Rome serves as a rich source of inspiration and continues to impact modern-day design.
